# Background: R-universe

## Installing a package {.huge}
 
<br>

```r
install.packages(
  "crew"
)
```

## What's really happening {.huge}

<br>

```{r, `code-line-numbers` = "3"}
install.packages(
  "crew",
  repos = getOption("repos")
)
```

## You can choose the repository {.huge}

<br>

```{r, `code-line-numbers` = "3"}
install.packages(
  "targets",
  repos = "https://wlandau.r-universe.dev"
)
```

<br>

. . .

I created <https://wlandau.r-universe.dev> with R-universe!

## Step 1: list the packages

<div style="font-size:0.9em">

`packages.json` file at [github.com/wlandau/wlandau.r-universe.dev](https://github.com/wlandau/wlandau.r-universe.dev):

```json
[
  {

    "url": "https://github.com/ropensci/targets"
  },

```

</div>

<br>

```{json, `code-line-numbers` = "4"}

```

## R-universe is community-driven {.Huge}

<br>

1. Package authors control publishing.
2. Package updates are frictionless.

. . .

<br>

Can we scale this inclusive approach? 


# R-multiverse

## R-multiverse: a dual repository

<br>

1. Community: R-universe repository with latest releases.
2. Production: quarterly snapshots of only healthy releases.

## Key features

1. High automation
1. Democratic:
    * [x] Package contributors control the release cycle.
    * [x] Recruiting moderators from across the community.
1. Transparent and open:
    * [x] Governance
    * [x] Policies
    * [x] Communication
    * [x] Infrastructure

# Community repository

## Community repository

![](./images/community-universe.png){fig-align="center"}

. . .

An R-universe repository: [community.r-multiverse.org](https://community.r-multiverse.org)

. . .

Latest GitHub/GitLab releases of all registered packages.

## Community repository

![](./images/community-universe.png){fig-align="center"}

. . .

Middle ground between development and production.

. . .  

The "QA" (quality assurance) of R packages.

## One-time registration on GitHub {.huge}

![](./images/register1.png){fig-align="center"}

<br>

## Automated review

<br>

![](./images/register2.png){fig-align="center"}

## Releases from GitHub/GitLab

![](./images/release.png){fig-align="center"}

. . .

Releases come directly from GitHub/GitLab.

. . . 

Package maintainers have complete control!

## Installing from the Community repository {.huge}

<br>

```{r, `code-line-numbers` = "2,4"}
install.packages(
  "webchem",
  repos = c(
    "https://community.r-multiverse.org",
    getOption("repos")
  )
)
```

# Production repository

## Quarterly snapshots

![](./images/calendar.jpg){fig-align="center"}

. . .

Production is deployed 4 snapshots each year.

. . .

Healthy releases from Community.

. . .

Soft landing from Community to Production.

## Staging universe manages transition

## Installing from the Production repository {.production}

<br>

```{r, `code-line-numbers` = "2,4,5"}
install.packages(
  "polars",
  repos = c(
    "https://production.r-multiverse.org/2025-03-15",
    "https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/2025-01-15"
  )
)
```
